content: I'm soon going to add the ballot categories for the 2018-Sep ballots. As a reminder no-one should be changing the ballot category of any submitted ballot. You can freely change the specification and other information if it was clearly categorized in error. However, if there's an error in the ballot category, you need to talk to myself or Grahame. The only gForge items that are allowed to have ballot categories are those that came from ballot spreadsheets posted to the ballot desktop that have been imported by the automated process.

Note that each work group is responsible for cleaning and triaging the results for their IG ballots so that Josh can load them into gForge. All FHIR-associated ballot content MUST be loaded into gForge. Can you please let me know if you're going to take on coordination for one of these specifications:
BSeR ???
Breast Cancer ???
CRD Lloyd
DEQM Eric
ECRCR ???
IPS Brian Postlethwaite
LIVD Eric
PRO Lloyd
PoCD ???
PDDI ???
SDC Lloyd
VHD Brian Postlethwaite
CRN Lloyd
ODH ???
FHIRPath Lloyd
Instructions are here: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/HL7/Process+for+Importing+Ballot+Spreadsheets+to+gForge

I think I'm the most directly involved in IPS and LIVD - so I would be happy to take one or both of them (or can leave them to Brian and Eric if they prefer)
if needed, I could also volunteer to do ODH
Lloyd, I was planning on taking FHIRPath if that helps
@Bryn Rhodes Sure. @Rob Hausam You can take all of those until/unless someone wants to arm-wrestle you for them
@Brian Postlethwaite let me know if you want me to take on VHDIR too.
@Rob Hausam yes can you do LIVD?
yes, I'll do LIVD

NOTE: I corrected step 7 of the confluence page. The ballot column isn't supposed to list the Ballot (you tell Josh that when you give him the spreadsheet). The ballot column should contain the Specification. (And if someone has balloted against the wrong spec, you can change the specification if it's not a negative against a normative candidate. E.g. for votes against an IG, you might indicate that some issues are against the IG while others are against a base IG or FHIR Core.)

.... so for example...for the DEQM Spreadsheet I put in 2018-Sep DEQM in the ballot column but it should be US Da Vinci DEQM It would be helpful to link to an example cleaned up row for an ig if you have one handy.

also for Tracker# is it:

  • 17893
  • GF#17893
  • or https://gforge.hl7.org/gf/project/fhir/tracker/?action=TrackerItemEdit&tracker_item_id=179893

I have seen it entered all three ways.
The third way by Josh which makes me wonder if that is the right way...
Yes, that's wrong. It should be "US Da Vinci DEQM".
I've committed the initial cleaned versions of a few of the specs in the HL7 documents git repository (under ballots)
ty

I've created a Google spreadsheet to manage the process. Please fill in the priority column and add your CSV to Git and update the spreadsheet when you're ready to have stuff imported. https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1iTS6lmX9E8BvbVbRoAaHjATjH0YHxm7oIxz9Oql46HU
Everyone should have received a link to the spreadsheet - if not, holler.
@Brian Postlethwaite I am working on VHDR ballot now....
Thanks Eric, I'm only just here, and will be preparing for tomorrow, and sleeping (best I can anyway)
@Brian Postlethwaite Good I'll prep it and get it all uploaded and get the build working again.
Anyone want to do Electronic Case Report? Laura (the lead) is out on sick leave.
:cricket: s

couple of other edits to the instructions.

  • the headers contain line feeds or carriage returns '\n' and Lloyd told me to remove. maybe the macro could do that but in the meantime that is a step too.
Okay, I have a csv for FHIRPath, but I don't have access to that documents repository so I can't push it.
You should have access now
Others can either ask for access or email to me and I'll commit. (Bryn, please commit the spreadsheet alongside the others too so it's handy for building the reconciliation sheet when we're done.)
Done, and I committed the spreadsheet too.
And I removed the BOM (thanks Visual Studio)
To verify, newlines are okay in the content, just not the headers, right?
Right
Lloyd - I will still do eCR.
Thanks Laura
Hi ho! I need access to the repository so that I can push the CRD material.
git id?
